_exec_summary.SummaryText:
(a)  ACCIDENTAL RESEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

Cytec is a leader among chemical manufacturers in its safety, health and environmental programs.  Our commitment to protect our employees and the communities that are home to our operations is an integral part of Cytec's way of doing business.  Cytec has established safety, health, emergency response and environmental policies and standards designed to meet or exceed all regulatory requirements.  As a member of the American Chemistry Council (ACC), Cytec subscribes to the codes established for Responsible Care (R).

(b)  THE WALLINGFORD PLANT AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED

Our facility has two departments that involve regulated substances.  The departments manufacture organic plastics and resins.  

The Resins Department manufactures products that are used as raw materials in the coatings and adhesives industries.  The regulated substance used above threshold quanity in this department is formaldehyde.

The CYRO Department manufactures acrylics that are used to make medical devices and other plastic products.  The regulated substance used above threshold quanity in this department is acrylonitrile.

(c)  THE GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RESEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

Cytec's general accidental release prevention program includes:

- EPA 40 CFR 68 - Risk Management Plans
- OSHA 29 CFR 1910.119 - Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals
- OSHA 29 CFR 1910.120 - Hazardous Waste Operations & Emergency Response
- Other EPA, OSHA, DOT and State regulations
- Generally recognized & accepted engineering codes and standards, and
- Cytec Safety, Health, Environmental and Engineering standards.

The following engineering and administrative controls help prevent a release of acrylonitrile and formaldehyde:
- Operating procedures and attendance during transfer operations by trained personnel
- Locked transfer connections with verification of materials prior to unlo

ading
- High level, temperature and pressure controls with alarms and/or automatic shutoffs
- Fire prevention programs include Nitrogen inerting of certain process vessels, grounding systems, electrical wiring and equipment rated for hazardous equipment where necessary 
- Distributed computer control systems with uninterruptible power backup and independent safety and environmental alarms and/or interlocks
- Multiple level indicators and spill containment for storage tanks and production vessels
- An on-site waste water treatment plant
- 24 hour security guards and plant fire department presence
- Back up systems for process pneumatics, lighting, electrical power to certain process equipment, emergency cooling, process water, back-up power for plant communications 
- Fire extinguishing systems include water sprinklers, AFFF foam, high expansion foam, halon systems, fire walls, fire doors and fire valves on certain vessels
- Administrative controls include management of change procedures, mechanical integrity procedures, operating procedures, training programs for employees and contractors, contractor review procedures, pre-startup safety review procedures, process hazards analysis procedures, safety work permit procedures, hot work permit procedures and lockout procedures

(d)  5-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have been no incidents at the Wallingford Plant which meet the criteria for reporting in the previous five-years.
                                  
(e) EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

The Wallingford Plant has an extensive emergency response program.  This program includes actions to be taken by operating department, maintenance, utilities, office, technical, visitors, contractors, and plant emergency response employees.  This information can be found in the CYTEC, WALLINGFORD PLANT, EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN.  The onsite Cytec Fire Department drills regularly on various scenarios with the Town of Wallingford's Fire Department and is active in the Wallingford Local E

mergency Planning Committee (LEPC).  Drills with the Wallingford Fire Department are conducted several times a year and hands-on-training (i.e. structural fire fighting) is periodically provided at the Town Fire Service Training area.  In addition, CYTEC Emergency Response teams help provide training in hazardous materials to the Municipal Fire Department personnel.

(f)  PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

CYTEC Industries is continuously striving to upgrade its processes, control technology, employee training, inspection, repair and maintenance of process equipment in order to improve safety.  We have also been improving plant security since 9/11/01 and will continue to improve in the future.
